response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Movie Ratings\", \"description\": \"Write a function that determines the rating of a movie based on its name. The ratings are as follows:\\n- If the movie contains the word 'romantic', it is rated 'PG'\\n- If the movie contains the words 'action' and 'comedy', it is rated 'R'\\n- Otherwise, it is rated 'G'.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef rate_movie(title: str) -> str:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `title` (str): The name of the movie.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns a string representing the rating of the movie ('PG', 'R' or 'G').\", \"code\": \"def rate_movie(title: str) -> str:\\n    if 'romantic' in title.lower():\\n        return 'PG'\\n    elif 'action' in title.lower() and 'comedy' in title.lower():\\n        return 'R'\\n    else:\\n        return 'G'\", \"tests\": [\"assert rate_movie('Romantic Comedy') == 'PG'\", \"assert rate_movie('Action Man') == 'R'\", \"assert rate_movie('The Lion King') == 'G'\", \"assert rate_movie('Comedy of Errors') == 'G'\"] }"
